overview:
John Jones is fortyninegroupâ€™s Chief Connector. Mr. Jones has spent more than two decades in the businesses of content and technology, focused on the growth of business-to-consumer and business-to-business companies through strategic business development, creation, optimization and analysis of digital and social media campaigns, technological advances through application and platform development, content development, marketing and branding. Prior to forming fortyninegroup, Mr. Jones was SVP of Content for MediaNet Digital, a privately held business-to-business online media distribution company, where he was responsible for global management of licensing and relationships with MediaNetâ€™s content partners including all four major labels and their subsidiaries, thousands of independent labels, film studios and production companies. In addition, Mr. Jones oversaw the entire repertoire of content in the MediaNet Digital service, accounting for ingestion and processing new content and making millions of tracks available to consumers through MediaNet Digitalâ€™s distributors that included Yahoo!, Urge, Zune, Tesco, Target, AOL and Samsung. Additionally, John worked on distribution deals with Fortune 500 companies such as Yahoo, Microsoft, Samsung and Target to advance MediaNetâ€™s distribution. Mr. Jones led a team of Facebook developers in building a MediaNet-powered music application, and throughout his tenure, worked closely with product development teams to continually improve and enhance the end user functionality of MediaNet products and services. In 2006, MediaNet was named New Yorkâ€™s #1 technology growth company in revenue, by Deloitte and Touche.

Previously, Mr. Jones was involved in advancing the concept of delivering on-demand music through Cable TV. As VP and Programming Director of Viacomâ€™s The Box Music Network, he was in charge of music programming including creating online and offline promotions, developing strategic partnerships and integrating branding and marketing to enhance viewership and revenue. Prior to that, Mr. Jones spent more than five years overseeing music programming and as senior producer at MuchMusic, a globally-recognized music TV channel seen in over 40 million homes in the US and Canada, where he was responsible for doubling MuchMusicâ€™s audience. For his efforts, Mr. Jones was recognized as â€œOne of the 40 Most Influential People in Canadian Televisionâ€. In 1998, he launched the programming for MuchMoreMusic, a Much brand extension channel. Additionally, Mr. Jones A&Râ€™d several multi-platinum music compilations and initiated hybrid online and broadcast interactive content while at MuchMusic.

Mr. Jones started his career in radio, as music director at Canadian stations including CFNY-FM and CHFI-FM, where his significant efforts in re-positioning and re-formatting the stations resulted in doubling and tripling of their respective market shares, and both stations being recognized as â€œRadio Station Of The Yearâ€, while Mr. Jones was awarded â€œMusic Director Of The Yearâ€. Prior to working in commercial radio, Mr. Jones launched and programmed college station CKLN-FM, and was a jazz, blues, world and rock music producer for Canadaâ€™s national broadcaster, the CBC. Throughout his career, Mr. Jones has worked with artists from Eminem to Elvis Costello, Radiohead to Red Hot Chili Peppers, No Doubt to Neil Young, Smashing Pumpkins to Sinead Oâ€™Connor and Beck to David Bowie.

Born in Toronto, John Jones is an Electrical Engineering graduate from Ryerson University, with Post-Graduate Studies in Communications at York University, and cites renown Canadian Communications theorists Marshall McLuhan and Harold Innis among his influences. He has lived in Miami since 2000 where he is actively involved in Multisports as a leisure and fitness activity, and is both a council member on the Florida Region USATriathlon Council and represents Florida on the USATriathlon Age Group Council. Mr. Jones is an Ironman, Age Group Triathlon multiple event winner, race series winner and regular top 5 finisher at various Triathlon distances including Ironman distance races, as well as a Marathon Age Group event winner. His Personal Performance Records are viewable here. In addition to being an accomplished sailor, John Jones is an acknowledged expert in mid-century modern architecture and design, and an advocate of USGBC and LEED initiatives.
